chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Shekila L Howard was found guilty of Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).
  • Shekila L Howard was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Count 1 court costs to be paid while on supervision. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  
-Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
-Submit to Random Testing
-Participate in Assessment
-Pay Supervision Fees

2/4/2016  Hearing held-defendant withdrew her appeal. Court orders sentence commence. Clerk contacted DOC-agent will be in contact with defendant.

Judge Williams appears in absence of Judge Malloy / Defendant Shekila L Howard in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant in custody from the Ozaukee County Jail by video conference. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Golden motion for stay of sentence pending appeal. State does not take position/or object. Court grants motion and orders balance of sentence on both counts be stayed pending appeal.  Court is informed defendant will appeal both counts of the judgment of conviction. Court orders $250 cash bail posted with conditions. If posts bail after 4:00 pm on any day, she is to be held in custody and released the next morning so she can get scram bracelet the next day within 2 hours of release. Court adjourns case for status of appeal on 10/22/2015 at 8:45 am.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:45 am.
